I managed to play this game, here is the procedure I followed:-
1. Install the game from mounted image, after installation do not install Direct X and do not configure graphic settings(Just clear those two boxes which appears after installation). 

2. Go to the folder where you have installed the game and  then go the redist folder(in games installation folder) and then open direct X folder and look for direct X setup and run it as admin. Do the same for vcredist_x86(run as admin) which is in redist folder near Direct X folder.

3. Now in Sonic Generations folder look for Configuration Tool, run it as admin and set your graphic 
settings, then save and quit. 

4. copy contents from fair light folder which is found in mounted image and paste those contents in Sonic Generation folder and replace original files.

5. Run the game as admin, when you stuck at saving screen press A on your keyboard(I pressed A but nothing happened then I found out that pressing D is doing work. In the game whenever it was asking me to press A I had to press D and when it asked me to press B I had to press S. its A=my D and its B=my S. I do not know why. It may not be the case with you).

6. If you do not tuck at saving screen and you stuck at main menu screen where "NEW GAME" flashes then press A/D to start.  TO SELECT SOMETHING PRESS A/D. TO QUIT GAME DURING PLAY PRESS ENTER AND CHOSE YOUR OPTION TO SELECT ANY OPTION PRESS A/D.  

7. I think Direct X is the cause of any dll errors.

All the people who are having trouble with starting the game due to the DAMN Optimus technology in their Dell Laptop GPUs or the damn i5 or i7 series processors should do the following...

1. Get the Virtu Software which is available at this website (lucidlogix) http://wwwdotlucidlogixdotcom/driverdownloads-virtudothtml (replace dot with .)
2. Install the software and then restart your machine.
3. Then after the restart you will have the Virtu software window come up, where you can click the "on" and "off" button and turn it to "off" position. 
4. Then go to your configuration file in the installation folder( C:\Program Files (x86)\Sonic Generations) and configure your game settings to whatever you like (I have mine maxed out to 1080p with high settings all the way), you can also configure your gamepad if you want and then click "save and exit".
5. After that just run your game as "Run as Administrator" by right clicking your SonicGenerations.exe file. Ignore the Virtu box menu that will also be visible in the options menu when you right click the SonicGenerations.exe file and just select "Run as Administrator".
6. You can now start the game and play without problems...

This torrent is good, although some of you may be experiencing some difficulties getting the game to work. For those of you who are getting the "d3dx9_43.dll file is missing, try reinstalling the program to fix the problem" error, navigate to this link:
http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?d3dx9_43
And download the .dll file fixer and run the scan and fix this problem. And then after you have rectified this problem, you may get an error message that says "The steam client is not running" to correct this problem, you need to download Steam, to do this, go to this link and download and install Steam:
http://steam.en.softonic.com/
Once you have downloaded Steam, I think that you need to update it so it runs correctly so make sure that you update it. After the installation of Steam is complete, double click the Steam icon and you will see a menu that says things like "Create new account" or new PS3 players etc. (or something) Ignore everything on the menu and just make sure that the menu is opened, when the menu is opened. this means that the steam client is running, so while the menu is still opened, double click the Sonic Generations icon and it should work fine. You nay get a message about your current settings does not match your hardware, all you have to do is go to the configuration tool and make sure analytics is enabled so tick the box which says that. If you get another error message which says some nonsense about access is denied, remember this for future use, whenever you get a message which says access is denied, just run the same program as an administrator. So in this case, right-click the configuration tool icon and click run as administrator and you should be able to change and save settings successfully. This is all I have to say so if you have any other problems, Google will serve as a useful tool, I hoped this comment has helped you.
This torrent is good

This torrent is good, although some of you may be experiencing some difficulties getting the game to work. For those of you who are getting the "d3dx9_43.dll file is missing, try reinstalling the program to fix the problem" error, navigate to this link:
http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?d3dx9_43
And download the .dll file fixer and run the scan and fix this problem. And then after you have rectified this problem, you may get an error message that says "The steam client is not running" to correct this problem, you need to download Steam, to do this, go to this link and download and install Steam:
http://steam.en.softonic.com/
Once you have downloaded Steam, I think that you need to update it so it runs correctly so make sure that you update it. After the installation of Steam is complete, double click the Steam icon and you will see a menu that says things like "Create new account" or new PS3 players etc. (or something) Ignore everything on the menu and just make sure that the menu is opened, when the menu is opened. this means that the steam client is running, so while the menu is still opened, double click the Sonic Generations icon and it should work fine. You nay get a message about your current settings does not match your hardware, all you have to do is go to the configuration tool and make sure analytics is enabled so tick the box which says that. If you get another error message which says some nonsense about access is denied, remember this for future use, whenever you get a message which says access is denied, just run the same program as an administrator. So in this case, right-click the configuration tool icon and click run as administrator and you should be able to change and save settings successfully. This is all I have to say so if you have any other problems, Google will serve as a useful tool, I hoped this comment has helped you. And also, if you manage to get the game to start and you are at the screen where it tells you that this game saves data automatically and you don't know how to get past that, just press the letter "D" on your keyboard. The letters on the keyboard correspond with the letters said in the game are below, the letters in the game are on the left side and the letters on your keyboard (by default) are on the right side:
A- D
X- A
Y- W
B- S

Oh yeah, I forgot about this. If you have made sure that analytics is enabled and you still get the message about your current system settings do not match your hardware, all you got to do is to check the box that says "Analytics enabled" AND the stripe that says "Antialiasing" needs to be ON.

For those of you who are not finding the configuration tool, try looking in the star menu under "Sonic Generations" or if you can't find it there, try looking in computer where you installed Sonic Generations and look in the installation files and the configuration tool should be there.

I read that some of you guys are experiencing the game crashing, see if this information from this other site works:
